qas.question: What made it possible to design architecture through new means and methods?
What new type of construction allowed the making of skyscrapers?
What is an example of International Style?
What made it impossible to design architecture through new means and methods?
What old type of construction allowed the making of skyscrapers?
What is an example of Domestic Style?

context: Architects such as Mies van der Rohe, Philip Johnson and Marcel Breuer worked to create beauty based on the inherent qualities of building materials and modern construction techniques, trading traditional historic forms for simplified geometric forms, celebrating the new means and methods made possible by <a0_0>the <b5_0>Industrial Revolution<b5_0/><a0_0/>, including <a1_0><b6_0>steel-frame construction<b6_0/><a1_0/>, which gave birth to high-rise superstructures. By mid-century, Modernism had morphed into the <a2_0><b7_0>International<b7_0/> Style<a2_0/>, an aesthetic epitomized in many ways by the <a3_0><b9_0>Twin Towers<b9_0/><a3_0/> of New York's World Trade Center designed by <a4_0><b8_0>Minoru Yamasaki<b8_0/><a4_0/>.
